mods.note: John Merritt was a Union soldier from Madison County, New York. He enlisted as a private on August 9, 1862, Company D, 114th Regiment infantry, New York Volunteers. He served in several Louisiana campaigns and was mustered out on June 8, 1865. He describes his reasons for enlisting, yellow fever, battle at Port Hudson, a soldier being shot for desertion, military activities, camp life, and several months spent in the US General Hospital in Philadelphia.
